page.title: 12CHRISTMAS DAY IN HOPTON
page.content: Most people spend Christmas Day at home with their families. They decorate their homes with trees covered in small ornaments and tinsel. They go to Midnight Mass at church on Christmas Eve. They start Christmas Day much earlier than usual as there are many preparations to be done. They exchange presents before breakfast. All receive and send many cards and some telephone friends and relatives. Everyone has a proper Christmas dinner of roast turkey, brussel sprouts, peas, potatoes, carrots, cranberry sauce, gravy and stuffing, followed by Christmas pudding with brandy butter. They pull crackers at the table and forget their diets. After dinner they watch the Queen's Speech and their favourite programmes on television. It is a traditionally happy day.
